meanings.sent1: The school play was a fiasco when the backdrop fell down during the performance.
meanings.sent2: The project turned into a fiasco when the team missed the deadline.
meanings.sent3: The magician's attempt to pull a rabbit out of a hat ended in a fiasco when a duck appeared instead.
meanings.sent4: The party planning committee's attempt to organize the event was a fiasco, resembling a circus without a ringmaster.
meanings.sent5: The fiasco of the failed rocket launch left everyone disappointed and frustrated.

meanings.definition: A thing that is a complete failure, especially in a ludicrous or humiliating way.
meanings.sent1: The comedy skit turned into a fiasco when the main actor forgot all his lines.
meanings.sent2: The marketing campaign became a fiasco after the embarrassing typo in the slogan went viral.
meanings.sent3: The attempt to bake a cake without a recipe turned into a fiasco when it came out looking like a pancake.
meanings.sent4: The fashion show was a fiasco with models tripping over their own feet on the runway.
meanings.sent5: The talent show turned into a fiasco when the singer's microphone stopped working mid-performance.
